post: Discover The Power of the Printed Word! Join BRI in our continuous effort to provide pocket Constitutions teachers and students nationwide. Together, we can inspire the next generation to understand and protect the principles that define our democracy. Be part of this movement for civic education today!  https://lnkd.in/eE-zWeup  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #PowerofthePrintedWord

"My goal as a history teacher has always been to help students make meaningful connections to the past, to each other, and to the ideas that shape our world," says Elizabeth Summerlin, a Gary Colletti Conference Scholarship recipient and teacher at Mill Creek High School, GA. With support from the Bill of Rights Institute, Elizabeth attended the National Council for the Social Studies conference for the first time. From insights on leadership to sessions on grassroots movements and civic simulations, she gained invaluable tools to bring history to life for her students. Elizabeth shared, "BRIs dedication to civic education aligns perfectly with my classroom goals, helping students build connections that will shape their future." Read more, here  https://lnkd.in/g9gJhiTb  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI

MyImpact Challenge celebrates students who take action to make a difference in their communities. This national civic engagement program highlights service projects that address real-world challenges, showcasing the impact young leaders can have. Learn more about the initiative,  https://lnkd.in/eExWq2tj  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #MyImpactChallenge

"As a teacher, I have found the Bill of Rights Institute to be an invaluable resource… I have seen, first-hand, the confidence in my students abilities increase drastically." Donna Vitek, Liberty Tutors. Support teachers and students like these by donating to the Bill of Rights Institute today. Federal, state, or localwho's responsible? Teach students how the U. S. BRI Scholarship Recipient Mary DiFiore-Smith feels that social studies teachers carry the responsibility of telling as many stories as possible  especially the hard ones. Read to learn more about how Mary discovered her "why" and used it to help students find theirs in history.  https://lnkd.in/ehB67dDi

Discover Andrew Carnegies inspiring journey from immigrant to industrial leader, and explore how immigrants shaped American culture, built communities, and drove innovation like the steam engine and telegraph. BRIs elementary lessons bring history to life with primary sources, content-area literacy, and performance-based assessments. Perfect for grades 3-5, they help young learners explore the roots of modern America and the principles of citizenship. Start exploring today,  https://lnkd.in/ebT7rAVb  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #BRIJr

Celebrate America's 250th with BRI! Join the Bill of Rights Institute as we explore and honor the Founding principles that built our nation 250 years ago. Sign up for inspiring stories from America's history, resources to engage students, and ways to celebrate this historic anniversary. Let's reflect and celebrate together.  https://lnkd.in/eCNQzkZM
